showFullCode.title: Show Complete File
showFullCode.description: Show complete file for code, with bootstrap and error handling included.

Nodes.Text: Simple calculator API hosted on APIMATIC

The generated code uses a few Maven dependencies e.g., Jackson, OkHttp,
and Apache HttpClient. The reference to these dependencies is already
added in the pom.xml file will be installed automatically. Therefore,
you will need internet access for a successful build.
* In order to open the client library in Eclipse click on `File -> Import`.
* In the import dialog, select `Existing Java Project` and click `Next`.
* Browse to locate the folder containing the source code. Select the detected location of the project and click `Finish`.
* Upon successful import, the project will be automatically built by Eclipse after automatically resolving the dependencies.
The following section explains how to use the APIMATICCalculatorLib library in a new project.
For starting a new project, click the menu command `File > New > Project`.

Nodes.AlterateText: Add a new project in Eclipse

Nodes.Text: Next, choose `Maven > Maven Project` and click `Next`.

Nodes.AlterateText: Create a new Maven Project - Step 1

Nodes.Text: Here, make sure to use the current workspace by choosing `Use default Workspace location`, as shown in the picture below and click `Next`.

Nodes.AlterateText: Create a new Maven Project - Step 2

Nodes.Text: Following this, select the *quick start* project type to create a simple project with an existing class and a `main` method. To do this, choose `maven-archetype-quickstart` item from the list and click `Next`.

Nodes.AlterateText: Create a new Maven Project - Step 3

Nodes.Text: In the last step, provide a `Group Id` and `Artifact Id` as shown in the picture below and click `Finish`.

Nodes.AlterateText: Create a new Maven Project - Step 4

Nodes.Text: The created Maven project manages its dependencies using its `pom.xml` file. In order to add a dependency on the *APIMATICCalculatorLib* client library, double click on the ``` pom.xml ``` file in the ``` Package Explorer ```. Opening the ``` pom.xml ``` file will render a graphical view on the canvas. Here, switch to the `Dependencies` tab and click the `Add` button as shown in the picture below.

Nodes.AlterateText: Adding dependency to the client library - Step 1

Nodes.Text: Clicking the `Add` button will open a dialog where you need to specify APIMATICCalculatorLib in `Group Id`, apimaticcalculator-lib in `Artifact Id` and 1.0.0 in the `Version` fields. Once added click `OK`. Save the `pom.xml` file.

Nodes.AlterateText: Adding dependency to the client library - Step 2

Steps.Title: Add reference of the library project

Nodes.Text:
Once the `SimpleConsoleApp` is created, a file named `App.java` will be visible in the *Package Explorer* with a `main` method. This is the entry point for the execution of the created project.
Here, you can add code to initialize the client library and instantiate a *Controller* class. Sample code to initialize the client library and using controller methods is given in the subsequent sections.
The following parameters are configurable for the API Client:
The API client can be initialized as follows:

APIMATICCalculatorClient client = new APIMATICCalculatorClient.Builder()
    .httpClientConfig(configBuilder -> configBuilder
            .timeout(0))
    .environment(Environment.PRODUCTION)
    .build();

The generated code and the server can be tested using automatically generated test cases. 
JUnit is used as the testing framework and test runner.
In Eclipse, for running the tests do the following:

1. Select the project APIMATICCalculatorLib from the package explorer.
2. Select `Run -> Run as -> JUnit Test` or use `Alt + Shift + X` followed by `T` to run the Tests.
The gateway for the SDK. This class acts as a factory for the Controllers and also holds the configuration of the SDK.

Nodes.Text: * [Simple Calculator]($e/Simple%20Calculator)
An instance of the `SimpleCalculatorController` class can be accessed from the API Client.
SimpleCalculatorController simpleCalculatorController = client.getSimpleCalculatorController();

Nodes.Title: Get Calculate
Nodes.Name: getCalculateAsync
Nodes.Description: Calculates the expression using the specified operation.

Parameters.Name: operation
Parameters.Description: The operator to apply on the variables

operation.description: The operator to apply on the variables

UsageExample.HttpCallTemplate: {"method":"GET","url":"{% case environment %}{% when "production" %}https://examples.apimatic.io/apps/calculator{% else %}envrr{% endcase %}/{{ call["args"]["operation"] }}{% capture inline_query_capture_876234 %}&x={% if call["args"]["x"] != nil %}{{ call["args"]["x"] }}{% else %}null{% endif %}&y={% if call["args"]["y"] != nil %}{{ call["args"]["y"] }}{% else %}null{% endif %}{% endcapture %}{% if inline_query_capture_876234.size > 0 %}?{% endif %}{{ inline_query_capture_876234 | remove_first:'&' }}","headers":{% capture header_capture_9023987234 %}{% endcapture %}{{ '{' }}{{ header_capture_9023987234 | remove_first:',' }}},"body":{{ '{' }}"type":"none"}}
